caption: Really, really yummy food! Tastes homemade and not your average Thai place. Lots of real vegetables in the chicken soup and turmeric noodles Great service, too!

Sadly this was the worst Thai food that I’ve ever had (probably have been to 30 different restaurants and eaten that food hundred of times). The flavors were not fresh, panang curry just had a barely spicy brown sauce with beef and no vegetables or anything else). Tom kha seemed to not have galangal or lemongrass, it was just coconut milk soup.  We’ve ordered from the other location a long time ago and that was good
If you’re a fan of chicken and rice dishes, you must order the Khao Mun Gai from Sky Ice 9th Street. It is wholly comforting and delicious!

What disappointed me was I ordered online and asked some additional note but they just ignored it. When I open the bag I found they didn't even put utensils in it. It seemed their stuff were just inconsiderate. The takeout portion was way smaller than what I expected but the price was more expensive for it.
They serve big portions and for fair prices. very nice staff. 5 stars from me.

This restaurant has an ice cream parlor with the most delicious handmade ice cream flavors I have ever tried.   Wasabi Peanut Butter, Cucumber Lime,  Banana Nutella... they are all awesome.  I even had their Roasted Thai Coconut ice cream served at my wedding.  Now, my three-year old is in love with this place and the family that runs it.  5 stars.
I think this is the best Thai food in all of Brooklyn. Try the no carb pad Thai! Heaven!

The service is not what I expected, yes the ambiance is all boutique and lovely, but they need more patient waitresses. I went here with a friend and was treated really horrible,  I should have just went down the street to luck thai, the service there is way better. I dont know where the discrimination came from, but they need to learn a thing or 2 about customer service. I felt like she gave me some type of fake smile and attitude. Another thing is, I have a thing about hygiene, and this place lacks on certain things. I may try it one last time but I dont see it getting any better. Will update my rating if it does.

I used to love going here, today changed everything. The waitress that they have there was horrible,  she has a short temper. I asked her for new glasses for water because there was lipstick on the ones I had, and she gave me a really nasty attitude because I asked her to give me another one. I then asked her something about the vegetarian plant based options, and again she gave me a nasty attitude. After the food came I sensed like she must have done something to the food because after eating I had a really bad stomach ache. I really do not know what caused her to be this way with me because I saw her being extra nice to other customers. I felt I should have just gotten up and left. This will be the last time I ever go here. No good customer service anymore .

We fell in love with its originally inconspicuous sister in north slope, and since we started going to their new location, it has been up to the same (high) standard! A unique Thai place with dishes you wouldn’t find elsewhere. The owner is typically there at the new location and is very accommodating and makes sure everyone leaves full and happy!

Seriously people, get yourself to Sky Ice any time of the day. This place bursts with delicious...lunch, dinner, dessert. Always serves up some warm feelings of a great neighborhood spot while having a consistently interesting menu. Currently having krapraw gai sub. It’s perfect, but honestly it’s hard to find anything less than wonderful. Just go. Enjoy. Either location (there’s 2).
Certainly the best local Thai food, much fresher and interesting flavors. The staples, like noodle dishes, are just more exciting and delicious.
Cute place.
friendly service food is pretty decent

Cool place. Very kind staff. They had traditional dishes and some cool ones that I didn’t recognize. The food was very good. We didn’t try the ice cream. Setup was nice with a restaurant area and another area that had an ice cream parlor feel. Prices were reasonable.

Was looking for a dessert place and found this on yelp. Got the ice cream flight and chose various Asian inspired flavors. They have a good variety of flavors and I pretty much liked all that I've tried.
Great restaurant, very yammi dishes, lovely setting. Thank you!
If in the hood for a quick lunch, try the prix fixe. You get choices of well combined Thai dishes. Great for tasting and good fuel for your day.
Best kraprow I've had since Thailand

Decor- very quality and cozy place  Food- The chicken satay was sweating with oil and parts of the skewer was not cooked well 🥴  Pad See Ew and Thai Iced Tea was both tasty and delicious  Would hesitate to return
Good Thai food with great options for vegetarians. My favorite is the No Carb Pad Thai made with papaya noodles, perfect if you want a lighter meal.

We visited their other location 63rd 5th before and really enjoyed the food, so we decided to visit this location yesterday. Met the owner Johnathan and his wife. Very nice and friendly couple. We talked about food, restaurants, Thailand etc. Comfortable, cozy and clean place. Since we had the food before we know it was not going to disappoint. If you love Thai food like us and want authentic Thai you have to come to Skyice. From the appetizer to dessert is delicious. I had a drink recommended by the owner... It was an hibiscus ( in the Caribbean we call it sorrel) lemonade ....it was refreshing and delicious. You have to visit, I promise u,  you will be back for more. Before u leave u have to try dessert...

I had their papaya pad Thai.. delicious and then had their mock mojito with sorbet.  They just redecorated, redid the menu and offer a full Thai food menu, ice cream, and sorbet. Great spot to stop in and try.
Delicious, authentic food! Restaurants like this make me want to live in Brooklyn. If you enjoy spicy thai food, you cannot not try out this restaurant.

So many Thai places in NY and I keep coming back to this one. Glad to see they’ve expanded into another location. Beautiful interior, food amazing as always and the ice cream flavors are totally unique.

Just went there tonight for dinner the second time since they opened. Very friendly place with good service and excellent Thai food. The standards like curry or noodles are very good and the Khao Soi is delicious - highly recommended!

Excellent Thai food that is out of this world. Authentic, healthy and unique. Best ice cream on the planet!! Tremendous variety of flavors and options for everyone. Always something new to try. My kids are constantly begging to go back. SkyIce is rapidly becoming a Brooklyn institution.

“GENUINE, AUTHENTIC PROVINCIAL THAI FOOD &  ALL NATURAL ARTISANAL SORBETS & ICE CREAMS”  Skyice has a magnificent new eatery on Fifth Avenue and 9th Street in wonderful Park Slope, Brooklyn. Skyice at St Marks Place has been recognized “Best Thai in Brooklyn.” The 9th Street eatery is a continuation of this marque! The menu is magnificent with novel accents. Pure home cooking is the order of the day and Skyice’s standard. The new restaurant is decorated and designed beautifully incorporating authentic Thai and American accents. Service is terrific: friendly, swift, and professional. The owners shop and source daily for the finest ingredients. They have pride and honor in their life’s work. Indeed the Sky is the Limit!
Everything about this place is amazing!!! Highly recommend the Larb Tord and Thai Beef Jerky. The ice cream selection is one of a kind. Go there if you haven’t been already!!!!

Such a beautiful restaurant in a section of Park Slope that is ready for high end Thai food. This place is from the same masterminds that created SkyIce Thai Food & Ice Cream. Incredible artistic details on the walls and furnishings with accented lighting. The food is simply delicious. The whole fried snapper with mango salad is my go to order, but it’s always tough to choose over the perfect Kao Soi and the rest of the authentic Thai food dishes on the menu. The Thai beef jerky is ridiculously good too (they use sirloin to make it, so tender). The ice cream that SkyIce is famous for is available in a wide variety of flavors, situated in an old fashioned ice cream parlor in the back of the restaurant. Knock out Thai flavors...durian, Thai coffee, black sesame seaweed and my other faves, white miso almond, banana nutella and Belgian chocolate brownie. I’ve been to several cities in Thailand and SkyIce 9th St has a staff that is just as friendly and attentive as any place in Bangkok or Chaing Mai. Highly recommend!

I was so happy to hear that SkyIce was opening this location just 3 blocks from my apartment! I've spent some time in Thailand and I feel like this is the most authentic Thai food you can get in Brooklyn. They have some really special dishes that you can't find anywhere else, and the food is always so fresh and healthy (like their non-fried curry puffs and no-carb pad Thai.) My kids also love their chicken satay, which they call "chicken lollipops" and the mango sorbet. I'm definitely a SkyIce addict!

Amazing. Love this new location. I’ve been going to SkyIce for years. Started going for the ice cream. The craziest flavors and they are delicious. Love the black sesame. The Thai food rocks too. Something about how they do it just makes it stand out versus everyone else. This is my go-to comfort spot.
Ordered the chicken larb salad / tom yum boran noodle. food was mediocre. i wouldn't return.

Great food with interesting Thai dishes. Especially loved the crab dish - very spicy but not so bad that you only taste the heat. For an appetizer I especially love the beef jerky. Price is right, food is excellent, service is spot on. And don’t forget the yummy ice cream for dessert

Miss the old Thai restaurant that was in this location before SkyIce!!! SkyIce food and service isn't as good. They are a bit slow and over priced. There menu isn't as varied. Seems like their focus is really on the ice cream they serve but haven't tried it.

I live a few blocks away and stumbled across this restaurant. Definitely a bit of a hidden gem, since it didn't even show up on Yelp or Google (until recently). Also used to be Sai Thai, which I got takeout from every now and then.  I went to check it out and had the Krapow Gai Sub and was blown away. Also had the roasted coconut ice cream which was also delicious.  Since then, I've gone religiously and ate something different every time. Every dish and dessert has been great. The food is on par with some of the best Thai places I've been to in New York (e.g. UpThai), and I love that they have some of the more authentic Thai dishes, not just pad thai, pad see ew, and the regular curries.  Overall, I can't recommend it enough, and definitely the best Asian restaurant in southern Park Slope, which, as someone who loves all kinds of Asian food, is more than welcome.
Very good
Must try! Authentic Thai food and the Thai Tea Ice Cream is so Yummy.
